benchmark_details.name: REALMATH
benchmark_details.overview: REALMATH is a novel benchmark for evaluating the mathematical capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) using authentic research-level mathematics tasks sourced from research papers and forums. It assesses LLMs' performance on mathematical tasks that represent real-world scenarios, as opposed to conventional competition problems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the mathematical capabilities of LLMs on tasks relevant to contemporary mathematical practice.

data.source: Research papers from arXiv and Mathematics Stack Exchange.
data.size: 633 high-quality samples curated from approximately 9,000 academic papers.
data.annotation: Automatically generated question-answer pairs based on extracted mathematical statements.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the proportion of correct answers provided by LLMs against ground truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of models on real-world mathematical tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Leading models achieved accuracy rates of 43-49% on Math.arXiv papers.
methodology.validation: Models were validated using multiple datasets from Math.arXiv and Stack Exchange.
